# Draft:Whimsical (software)

|
Whimsical is a collaborative Software as a service platform that combines project management, documentation, diagramming, mind mapping, whiteboarding, wireframing, and team communication tools designed to streamline workflows by reducing reliance on multiple applications.
History
Founding and Early Years (2017–2020)
Whimsical was founded in 2017 in Denver, Colorado, by Latvian entrepreneur Kaspars Dancis, who had previously built several other successful startups, including Cobook, a Latvian startup acquired by FullContact. Soon after its founding, Dancis’ former FullContact colleague Steve Schoeffel joined the company as co-founder.
In its early days, Whimsical offered simple flowcharts, followed by wireframes and mind maps, and its emphasis on design clarity and ease of collaboration quickly attracted product teams and creative professionals worldwide.
Growth and Investment (2021–2024)
In 2021, Whimsical raised $30 million in Series A funding led by Accel to accelerate product development and expand its reach. By then, it had grown to a couple of million users. Prior to this, the company had been entirely bootstrapped and profitable since its early days. Accel partner Dan Levine, who joined Whimsical’s board, described the company as offering a foundational product for remote-first teams, comparing it to tools like Figma and Notion in its focus on speed and simplicity.
Transition to an All-in-One Platform (2025–present)
In February 2025, Whimsical launched **Projects**, completing its “all-in-one” offering for ideation, planning, execution, and communication. This milestone reinforced Whimsical’s commitment to asynchronous, calm work by integrating ideas, documents, boards, and tasks into a single, interconnected space.
Technology
Whimsical is written in the Clojure programming language. The company has been recognized within the Clojure community for its large-scale, production use of the language, often cited as an example of how functional programming principles can be applied to build complex, collaborative web applications. Whimsical’s engineering team has contributed to open-source Clojure projects and has participated in community events, reinforcing its commitment to the language’s ecosystem.
Sustainability
Since 2020, Whimsical has partnered with Stripe, Inc. to donate 1% of its annual revenue to scientifically vetted carbon-removal technologies, integrating sustainability into its business model.
Whimsical has contributed over $50,000 through this program, financially backing its environmental commitment while focusing on building its product.
